subjects_details: 7 healthy volunteers before abstaining for 3 weeks from smoking; The seven healthy volunteers from the hospital staff aged from 25 to 45 years. All smoked 10-20 cigarettes daily. There was no interfering pharmacotheraphy.

7 healthy volunteers before abstaining for 3 weeks from smoking; The seven healthy volunteers from the hospital staff aged from 25 to 45 years. All smoked 10-20 cigarettes daily. There was no interfering pharmacotheraphy.
8 smoking healthy volunteers and patients without liver disease
15 non-smoking healthy volunteers and patients without liver disease

18 smoking patients with alcoholic liver cirrhosis; The second group consisted of 18 smokers and 30 nonsmokers with clinically established and, in most patients, biopsy-proven alcoholic liver cirrhosis. Cigarette consumption ranged from 5 to 40 cigarettes daily in smokers.

30 non-smoking patients with alcoholic liver cirrhosis; The second group consisted of 18 smokers and 30 nonsmokers with clinically established and, in most patients, biopsy-proven alcoholic liver cirrhosis. Cigarette consumption ranged from 5 to 40 cigarettes daily in smokers.
